input.code:
require 'date'

# Debug - log input to see what's really coming in
puts "Input: #{input.inspect}"

# Safe date parser
def safe_parse_date(value)
  return nil if value.nil?
  return value.to_date if value.respond_to?(:to_date)

  begin
    Date.parse(value.to_s)
  rescue ArgumentError
    nil
  end
end

# Get input values (ensure these keys match input schema EXACTLY)
start_date = safe_parse_date(input['ExpiringProductStartDate'])
end_date = safe_parse_date(input['ExpiringProductEndDate'])

# Debug - log parsed dates
puts "Parsed start_date: #{start_date}"
puts "Parsed end_date: #{end_date}"

# If parsing fails, return 0
if start_date.nil? || end_date.nil?
  { days: 0 }
else
  # Count days excluding Feb 29
  days = (start_date..end_date).count { |d| !(d.month == 2 && d.day == 29) }
  { days: days }
end
